intro: Poikilogyne carinata, commonly known as the zigzagged spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, zigzagging stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Poikilogyne carinata is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its diverse and often strikingly adapted species.
